alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 12:22PM EST until January 16 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Indiana... White River .Upwards of two inches of rainfall last weekend put several rivers across central and southern Indiana into flood. Up to another inch of rain fell last night. Minor flooding is occurring on the White River from around Petersburg and southward in southwest Indiana. The river level is expected to be above flood stage through next weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH NEXT SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until next Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Low bottomlands flood and flooding begins on higher bottomlands. State Road 257 may begin to flood if Shoals gage reading is over 17 feet. Private levees may be overtopped in many cases. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EST Sunday /10:30 AM CST Sunday/ the stage was 16.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM EST Sunday /10:30 AM CST Sunday/ was 17.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.6 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1115 PM CST /1215 AM EST/.
